title: Null Hypothesis Definition
text: $$H_0$$, the —null hypothesis: a statement of no difference between sample means or proportions or no difference between a sample mean or proportion and a population mean or proportion.

title: Alternative Hypothesis Definition
text: H_a—, the alternative hypothesis: a claim about the population that is contradictory to $$H_0$$ and what we conclude when we reject $$H_0$$.

title: How to Approach the Alternative Hypothesis
text: If we are asked to find test whether a parameter (such as the mean time for runners) is a certain value, the alternative hypothesis should be a claim that the true parameter is NOT that value, which would require the use of a "not equal" sign.
